attributes.comment:
I am writing to express my concern regarding the proposed increase on fees
pertaining to international adoptions. This topic affects me, my husband, our
families, and the future of our soon to be adopted child, as well as the future of
countless children of all ages who need adopted. Adoption has proven to be a
difficult process administratively, emotionally, and financially. During this
process, I've met many people wanting to be parents to love, protect, and educate
children and are unable to do so because of the outrageous expense involved.
How many children are left behind in orphanages and inadequate foster homes all
over the world because people who would be great parents cannnot afford to adopt
them? It also angers me to read this docket to learn that the fees are being
raised to cover the costs of other immigrants who have made their own decisions
to come to this country. Like thousands of people, we are working hard to save
the money for our child's adoption, and to raise them in this country. Do not
make it more difficult for the parents who want to do the same, and for the children
who will have the opportunity to grow up as United States taxpaying citizens.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Nanette Higgins
